data.text: Different places on the Earth have different climates.
Places close to the Poles have a very cold climate throughout the year.
Places close to the equator have a very hot climate throughout the year.
In places where there is a lot of rainfall and many trees, people make houses from wood.
In dry areas, people build houses with flat roofs.
In areas with high rainfall or snowfall, houses have sloping roofs so that rain or snow can slide off.
In areas close to the North Pole there are no trees, so people used to make houses using blocks of snow.
Some crops grow well in a cold climate, while some grow well in a warm climate.
Some special lines of latitude divide the Earth into four climatic zones.
The area between 5° north and south of the equator is called the equatorial region.
The area between 23.5° north and south of the equator is called the tropical region.
The area between 23.5° and 66.3° north and south of the equator is called the temperate region.
Pakistan is located just to the north of the Tropic of Cancer.
Some places like Quetta have very severe winters, whereas places like Jacobabad have extremely hot summers.
